column4: hey all - is anyone else having overheating problems with breezy that didn't occur in hoary?
yah
it's like the fan decides to go away or something
I'm going to run another liveCD with the 2.6.12 kernel to see if it's just with breezy, or with the 2.6.12 tree
yah
Sgershon are you using gnome or kde?
not sure where it is because I'm in kde
Sgershon, select hebrew as one of the keyboards
Sgershon, then you need to go into OOo go to tools ==> options and in that window select "language settings"
Sgershon under languages, check the "CTL" box - and then select hebrew at the default CTL language
what video card u got?
no but strangly enough i did have that problem in hoary
weird
what kernel are you running?
2.6.12-686-smp  .........  not on my ubuntu machine so i dont know the exact kernel
when I run that kernel, I get the overheating problems, when I run 2.6.10 - no problems
the bummer is that I've got 3d acceleration working in the 2.6.12 kernel!!!
thats easy enough to use with the 2.6.10 kernel though
nope - I need the k7 kernel or the module won't compile!
oh
I guess I could just download the 2.6.10 source package and recompile it to be k7 optimized!
it's a S3 Unichrome
the REAL bummer is that the unichrom dri module is included in the latest kernel!
